selected_quotes: asymmetrical commitment was not nearly as important a predictor of breakup as females’ levels of commitment.
Break-up rates in couples where one partner is more committed than the other
USA: 1 in 3 young unmarried couples had asymmetric relationships - 1 partner more committed, other less committed
Mutual plans to marry also crucial to realization of marriage. I know that seems obvious, but . . .
Asymmetrical #commitment represents one of the most interesting additions to the commitment literature

news.title: Convivir no implicaría un mayor compromiso para la pareja
news.summary: Texto: Estefanía Papescu Irse a vivir en pareja antes de casarse, se estila cada vez más.

news.title: Couple cohabitation tends to affect women adversely more than men
news.summary: A new study examining the commitment levels of young couples casts doubt on the modern wisdom that moving in together is a prudent step before marriage — especially for women.

news.title: Weaky-Links: The Pain of Asymmetrical Commitment
news.summary: by Scott M. Stanley & Galena K. Rhoades Perhaps you’ve been there, or watched some friend go through the pain of it.

blogs.summary: With some couples, one partner is substantially more committed than the other. We call these Asymmetrically Committed Relationships (ACRs). No one who is looking for lasting love wants to find themselves in an ACR, but we suspect it has become increasingly

blogs.title: Asymmetrical Commitment in Unmarried Relationships
blogs.summary: by Scott Stanley and Galena RhoadesWith some couples, one partner is substantially more committed than the other. We call these Asymmetrically Committed Relationships (ACRs). No one who is looking for lasting love wants to find themselves in an ACR but we

author.name: Sliding vs Deciding:  The Blog of Scott Stanley
author.description: This blog is about relationships--especially about marriage and romantic relationships. Most of the entries contain insights about how relationships develop, or about what makes or breaks them. Many themes are focused on issues of emerging adults and the period before people settle down such as in marriage. Some entries are about bigger societal or science issues.
